result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Juras was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment. Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 upon successful completion, felony charge only.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.  Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AR.   Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No bars, taverns or liquor stores or any business whose sole business is alcohol.
11/12/18 Crt amends no contact to no acts or threats of violence.

Childcare arrangments to be done through a third party, agent or grandparent. Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes: Can terminate early at 2 yrs if Probation agent agrees.

superTimeConds.notes: 20 hrs/wk if not in work, school or treatment.

supervisions.notes: 8/3/15: Court orders 2 years of probation on count 2 instead of 3 years.

miscConds.notes: Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

supervisions.notes: Concur to ct 1.  To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).

Defn requests sig bond w/BMP.  State objects.  Ct grants sig bond w/BMP - all other conditions remain.

SIGNATURE BOND SET - REFERRAL TO BMP
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  BMP Electronic and random UA/BA.  
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
